channel.title: Programming on UNH COMP RESOURCES
channel.description: Recent content in Programming on UNH COMP RESOURCES

item.title: C++ Programming
item.description: About C++ is a middle-level language rendering it the advantage of programming low-level (drivers, kernels) and even higher-level applications (games, GUI, desktop apps etc.). The basic syntax and code structure of both C and C++ are the same. Some of the features & key-points to note about the programming language are as follows: Simple: It is a simple language in the sense that programs can be broken down into logical units and parts, has a rich libray support and a variety of data-types.

item.title: Java Programming
item.description: Code Structure in Java: The source code file holds one class definition. The class represents a piece of the program. A class has one or more methods. A method is a set of statements that states how a method should be performed. How Java works: Type a source code file(example.java). Compile source code file to create a bytecode. The compiler gives complied output file(exampe.class) Java virtual machine runs an example.class file.

item.title: Perl Programming
item.description: About Perl is the Swiss Army chainsaw of scripting languages: powerful and adaptable. It was first developed by Larry Wall, a linguist working as a systems administrator for NASA in the late 1980s, as a way to make report processing easier. Since then, it has moved into a large number of roles: automating system administration, acting as glue between different computer systems; and, of course, being one of the most popular languages for CGI programming on the Web.

item.title: Python Programming
item.description: About Python is an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language. Created by Guido van Rossum and first released in 1991, Python’s design philosophy emphasizes code readability with its notable use of significant whitespace. Its language constructs and object-oriented approach aim to help programmers write clear, logical code for small and large-scale projects. Python is dynamically typed and garbage-collected. It supports multiple programming paradigms, including procedural, object-oriented, and functional programming. Python is often described as a “batteries included” language due to its comprehensive standard library.
